Message.Title: Cirrus Logic Guidance Bode Well for Iphone5 Launch
Message.Msg: From Seeking Alpha Mr Davenport writes... "Cirrus Logic (CRUS), which gets over 60% of its revenue from AAPL and is designed in iPhones, iPads, Macs, and iPods. CRUS' FQ1 (June) revenues of $99M were essentially in line with Street expectations of $100.9M, but its FQ2 guidance of $170-190M represents ~80% Q/Q growth at the midpoint, and crushed already strong Street expectations of $129.7M." This is massive! Next level for AAPL is $700

Message.Title: Apple's (AAPL) iPhone 5 Likely to Be Compatible with China Mobile - Analyst
Message.Msg: Apple's (AAPL) iPhone 5 Likely to Be "True World Phone" and Compatible with China Mobile - Analyst While upside for Apple's (NASDAQ: AAPL) iPhone will be less likely in the June and September quarters, analyst at Sterne Agee say they continue to believe the iPhone 5 will be a significant upgrade and will likely be a "true world phone" meaning compatibility with China Mobile (NYSE: CHL). Due to lower supplier build plans, iPhone upside in the June and September quarters is less likely, analyst Shaw Wu said. He remains comfortable with a forecast looking for 27 million and 25 million units, respectively, versus the consensus estimates closer to 30 million. "As we have said before, this is more of a function of the transition ahead of the upcoming 6th generation iPhone refresh likely in the October timeframe as opposed to weak demand," the analyst said. On the iPhone 5, checks will suppliers point to a significant upgrade with 3 key improvements: (1) a new form factor; (2) slightly larger screen; and (3) a 4G LTE wireless modem. "We believe these new features will likely help drive a significant upgrade and new user cycle more powerful than what we saw with the iPhone 4 and 4S." Another key features they the firm is picking up on is that the new iPhone will be a "true world phone" meaning the ability to work with the world's various 3G and 4G wireless networks, including China Mobile's proprietary TD-SCDMA 3G network. "We believe the combination of technology support and enhanced features in the iOS 6 refresh tailored for Greater China including the ability for Siri to understand and speak in Mandarin and Cantonese, easier Chinese character input, and integration with popular internet services including Baidu, Sina Weibo, Youku, and Tudou, make iPhone an even more attractive platform and bring it closer to a partnership with China Mobile," Wu said. For an analyst ratings summary and ratings history on Apple click here. For more ratings news on Apple click here. Shares of Apple closed at $585.74 yesterday, with a 52 week range of $315.20-$644.00

Message.Msg: ============================================= To compute the price AAPL should be today: ============================================= Step I: Compute PEG ratio = Divide FORWARD P/E by expected GROWTH RATE PCT. Message.Title: What's the reason of not allowing URL?
Message.Msg: This is the first board/forum that I have ever seen not allowing people posting URLs. I went to plenty of Chinese websites and see many occasion of Chinese internet police/thugs in action. My posts got deleted because of my "inappropriate" words. However none of those forums prohibit the posting of URLs. Chinese websites are the most restricted area of the Internet, yet they still allow it. But why not here? Do they really intent to be the only board that will delete your message if it contains anything looks like a URL? It is beyond believe that, a message board is supposed to be the place for the freedom of speech, but now whenever we have to discuss anything, we cannot point out the source, and have to use some indirect obscure way to tell others where the source is, like we are criminals and have things to hide. Topic.Title: blew cover and buy stops at 635

Message.Msg: Many things have happened today. Broke through ATH close resistance of 635.52. Broke through (at 637.8) the upper envelope 5SDs above the 22EMA. Pierced (not by much) the upper bull trend channel line (at 638.1). This behavior typically triggers a sharp pullback. Normally one would not be surprised if AAPL had already pulled back 10 or 12 points from the HOD (which would mean back down to 627 even right now) to be followed by a day or two of small pull-backs down to 620-615. So 632 is not looking so bad now. Also, if AAPL had kept going and closed above the trend channel line and the upper envelope, this would have been parabolic confirmation and begging for a precipitous correction. If AAPL can stay above 622 for the next couple of weeks, that`s a good sign. Any very near-term up is gravy. Pauses along the steep hike are always good. But again, I state the obvious.

Message.Title: Apple v. Samsung: Judge Koh loses cool over legal wrangling
Message.Msg: U.S. District Judge Lucy Koh has had her fill of courtroom "theatrics" and questionable legal maneuvering from both sides in the Apple v. Samsung patent trial. "I want papers," Koh told the court on Tuesday after Apple objected to one of Samsung's witnesses. "I don't trust what any lawyer tells me in this courtroom. I want to see actual papers." Koh was obviously frustrated when Apple and Intel tried to block Tim Williams, Ph.D., one of Samsung's expert witnesses from testifying. Apple said Williams had not properly disclosed that he had signed multiple nondisclosure agreements, one of which Intel says prohibits him from discussing the particulars of Intel's source code. That may not sound like that big a deal but the objections came just a few hours before Williams was scheduled to testify. And Koh has put up with a lot what she has called "theatrics" in the case. Samsung's lawyers have appeared to tax her patience more than their counterparts on the side. Related posts Top Samsung designer: We didn't copy Apple Samsung breaks out the oranges in its offensive against Apple Intel tries to get Samsung expert witness booted All of Apple's patent claims against Samsung in one chart iPhone owned 63 percent of smartphone marketshare at AT&T Samsung has been sanctioned four times, mostly for failing to turn over evidence. In one notable exchange with John Quinn, one of the founders of Quinn Emanuel, the lawyer firm leading Samsung's defense, Koh had to order him to stop talking. Quinn had begged Koh to reverse a decision regarding evidence she had decided shouldn't be shown to the jury. Quinn not only begged but when she failed to grant his request, he snapped at her. "What's the point of having a trial?" Quinn told Koh as he raised his voice. "What's the point?" At this point, it sounds like lawyers for both sides would do well not to test Koh's patience further.

Topic.Title: Pull the Trigger

Message.Msg: I disagree. Taking profit is a bad idea whenever you do something less valuable (and I mean that in the most general sense) with the proceeds. For example, there are a lot of people that bought AAPL at $12.33, like I did, but bailed with a profit hundreds of points ago. Given the charts out there for the past decade, most of these people would have been better off riding the wave. The key is understanding the business markets that your investments participate in. A rare lightning strike of timing up/down could help, but nobody can count on that as a reliable strategy. You are better off understanding which companies are in best position for the future. And if the answer is what you have now, even after a climb, taking profits is not the wise choice. Of course, this assumes you are astute enough to #$%$ said business markets. That's fine though, because if you aren't astute enough for making a good #$%$ment then you are screwed no matter what you do as an individual. Buy into mutual funds and pray they aren't dumb too, I guess. Thompson

Topic.Title: Apple v. Samsung: Judge Koh loses cool over legal wrangling

Message.Msg: I fear for Apple no matter what outcome. The only court that counts is the Court of Public Opinion, and the public is obviously buying Samsung products. Any outcome here will be appealed anyway, and Samsung will continue to flood the market with endless product refreshes. Apple really needs to rethink it's relatively slow product cycles...don't build a perfect mousetrap - just build a good-enough one more often to keep Samsung off balance. This is not about patent law or justice anymore, this is about beating the competition in the eyes and wallets of the consumer.

Message.Title: AT&T cancels training session due to schedule conflict
Message.Msg: Sources have also indicated AT&T cancelled an October regional training session, as it was in direct conflict with a "huge announcement." With iOS 6 launching this fall, and a heavy concentration of rumors pointing to Apple releasing multiple new iOS devices during that time frame, it makes a great deal of sense for the cellular carrier to clear its slate in anticipation of a massive sales rush. There's just under a month left until the speculated reveal of the iPhone 5, and it will be worth watching to see if providers follow AT&T's lead over the coming weeks. All things considered, it now appears as if it's just a matter of time until the iPhone 5 arrives on store shelves

Topic.Title: APPLE,SAMSUNG Trial- WORLD IS Saying one of the most RIGGED ,BIASED trials in history next to O.J Simpson trial.

Message.Msg: Whoah there pardner. . The "world" is saying the apple Samsung trial is rigged? I read French and Spanish papers daily, as well as several English papers. I haven't seen evidence of a world opinion. Sure there are diverse opinions as to what pricipals and outcomes should apply, as there are in the comments to your post. The legal blogs suggest this has been a remarkably patient judge who has had to put up with a lot of shannagans. Please cite your references concerning a world opinion. And a "corrupt" judge? Could you support the nature of this corruption? Are you suggesting a monetar connection between the judge's conduct, and Apple corporation. do you believe the judge ignored valid grounds for her reclusal (as far as i am aware there was never a motion made by either side for her reclusal).Are you aware that the federal judge hearing this case is of Korean ancestory. Some on this board claimed that and, her earlier decisions were pathognomonic indicators of her bias toward Samsung. Are you aware what it takes to become a federal as opposed to a district judge even if you are a political appointment. Do you know what a judicial review committe is and how it differs from an appellate court. Federal judges rely on precedent and dislike making it. Stripped Of its trappings this a basic patent infringement suit. Let's use a little common sense describing it and save the rhetoric and hyperbole for the loser in this very interesting contest.
